page.title: 03Campsall Village
page.content: The old village of Campsall nestles on the foot of a hill and includes a small group of old stone buildings now restored.The Vicarage is a 15th. century manor house,modernised in 1800 and is now called 'Tithe Barn House' The 'Old Bells'is an 18th century inn Inside it is a cosy old-fashioned pub. Post war development has created a second side to Campsall which has a very active community life including a Working Men's Club.In new Campsall there is a 20th.century Coal Board Estate,on Churchfield Road.There are also a few shops in new Campsall.There is a mixed comprehensive school on Ryecroft Road.Also on Ryecroft Road there is a 19th.century windmill,which is now used as a house.
